str2: Dissonant, discordant; met: at variance. Inharmonious.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Reciprocal Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: One another, each other. Genitive plural from allos reduplicated; one another.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and luo; to free fully, i.e. relieve, release, dismiss, or let die, pardon or divorce.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
From rheo; an utterance, ; by implication, a matter or topic; with a negative naught whatever.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Set apart by (or for) God, holy, sacred. From hagos; sacred.
Wind, breath, spirit.
Well, nobly, honorably, rightly. Adverb from kalos; well.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Isaiah, the prophet. Of Hebrew origin; Hesaias, an Israelite.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a compound of pro and phemi; a foreteller; by analogy, an inspired speaker; by extension, a poet.
